item.title: Singtel provides leasing options for high-end smartphones
item.description:
Singtel has introduced Singapore’s first mobile phone leasing program to make high-end devices more accessible. Subscribers with SIM Only plans can choose to pay a low monthly fee to use premium Apple and Samsung handsets instead of buying them outright. They can lease the newest Apple iPhone and Samsung Galaxy models for two years and have the option to upgrade in the twelfth month for a S$200 fee. With prices starting at S$35 per month for a Samsung Galaxy S9 (64 GB), customers can save up to S$578 off the regular retail price if they lease the phone for a year or S$358 if they keep it for two years...

item.title: Check Point has discovered a vulnerability in a preinstalled app on Xiaomi devices
item.description:
Slava Makkaveev, a researcher from cybersecurity firm Check Point Software, recently discovered a concerning security flaw in Xiaomi phones. This vulnerability was found within the pre-installed “Guard Provider” app (com.miui.guardprovider), designed to identify malware. Ironically, this app could allow attackers on the same Wi-Fi network to perform a man-in-the-middle (MiTM) attack. This type of attack enables the interception and copying of data transmitted between the phone and online services. Furthermore, by exploiting a third-party software development kit (SDK) update mechanism, attackers could potentially disable malware protection and inject malicious code...

item.title: Drowning in a Sea of Cell Phones
item.description:
Current estimations show approximately three billion mobile phone users globally, with a billion new devices sold annually. Given that phones are typically replaced every two to three years, this equates to roughly one billion phones becoming obsolete yearly. The question then arises: where do these discarded devices end up? Contrary to assumptions that they are forgotten in drawers, a recent study revealed that only 44% of old phones remain unused at home...

item.title: Evernote introduces a new and improved app with a redesigned interface
item.description:

item.title: Prioritizing mobile can lead to success

item.title: Criteo measures the passion for travel among Singaporeans
item.description:
